body_html:
I can see that would work. The reason I don't like that is that both of its side effects are unpleasant:

  1. either that a dummy file has to be created before the repo will build. if configure created it then that would be ok, but configure isn't very well designed or extensible at the moment.
  2. or that there will be a file in the repo that will be necessary to edit, but not to check in. its messy and prone to error.

I've never checked this out, but maybe you can check a file into the repo, and also include it in .gitignore. if that works, then it is a good solution.

body:
I can see that would work.  The reason I don't like that is that both of its side effects are unpleasant:

1) either that a dummy file has to be created before the repo will build.  if configure created it then that would be ok, but configure isn't very well designed or extensible at the moment.
2) or that there will be a file in the repo that will be necessary to edit, but not to check in.  its messy and prone to error.

I've never checked this out, but maybe you can check a file into the repo, and also include it in .gitignore.  if that works, then it is a good solution.
